abstract: John Stumpf, the new chief of Wells Fargo, said Wednesday that it is “highly unlikely” that the bank will make any big acquisitions outside its existing geographical markets. He did not rule it out, though, telling Reuters that, while “we don’t want to be big for big’s sake,” Wells Fargo would nevertheless “look at a larger transaction out of market.”
lead_paragraph: John Stumpf, the new chief of Wells Fargo, said Wednesday that it is “highly unlikely” that the bank will make any big acquisitions outside its existing geographical markets. He did not rule it out, though, telling Reuters that, while “we don’t want to be big for big’s sake,” Wells Fargo would nevertheless “look at a larger transaction out of market.”

headline.main: New Wells Chief Charts Stay-at-Home Deal Strategy
